question_sentence: Why did four NASA astronauts return to Earth from the International Space Station earlier than planned this week?
choices: Medical issue with a crew member
Damage to the ISS from space debris
evidence: Four astronauts aboard a SpaceX Crew Dragon capsule splashed down Thursday in the Pacific, ending a weeklong effort to bring a crew member home due to a medical illness.

question_sentence: Which wireless carrier reported an outage that spanned multiple states this week?
evidence: A Verizon outage on Wednesday temporarily left tens of thousands of US customers without the ability to make phone calls, send text messages or use data.

question_sentence: Which two states filed lawsuits this week against the Trump administration over its immigration operations?
evidence: Minnesota and Illinois separately filed lawsuits Monday against the Trump administration over the president’s immigration crackdown. Minneapolis has recently been the center of widespread protests, drawing national attention.

question_sentence: Which beverage is now allowed in US school lunches after President Donald Trump signed a new bill this week?
evidence: Whole milk is now allowed after President Trump signed a bill that allows schools participating in the National School Lunch Program to serve whole and 2% milk alongside fat-free and low-fat versions.

question_sentence: Which country are the US and several European nations urging their citizens to leave due to a deadly government crackdown?
evidence: The US and several European nations have advised their citizens to leave Iran as the government’s violent crackdown on anti-regime protests continues to escalate.

question_sentence: Cartoonist and author Scott Adams died this week following a battle with prostate cancer. He was best known for creating which comic strip?
evidence: Scott Adams created “Dilbert.” It was one of the country's most widely read comic strips from the 1990s until 2023, when many newspapers dropped it after Adams made racist comments.

question_sentence: Which state is investigating an alleged arson at its largest and oldest synagogue?
evidence: Authorities have arrested a suspect who confessed to setting fire to the largest and oldest synagogue in Mississippi.

question_sentence: Which major award show was recently held in Los Angeles?
evidence: The 83rd Golden Globe Awards took place on January 11 in Beverly Hills, celebrating some of the biggest hits in film and TV from the past year.

question_sentence: Which company made national headlines this week by debuting a new inclusive toy?
evidence: Mattel released the first-ever Barbie with autism, drawing praise from parents, educators and disability advocates.

question_sentence: Where will the Winter Olympics be held next month?
evidence: The Milan-Cortina Winter Olympics will take place from February 6-22, followed by the Paralympic Winter Games, scheduled from March 6-15.
